mixed-citation.article-title: Atlas of European millipedes 3: Order Chordeumatida (Class Diplopoda)

tp:treatment-sec.p:
Including Origmatogonidae Verhoeff, 1914 . The convoluted history of this family was briefly reviewed by Enghoff & Reboleira (2013) . The vast majority of the 33 European species occurs in the SW, one (
Chamaesoma broelemanni
) is distributed over most of France , and the two species of
Verhoeffeuma Strasser, 1937
occur in NE Italy and Slovenia . The family also has two species from North Africa:
Meinerteuma lucasii (Silvestri, 1896)
and
Origmatogona strinatii Manfredi, 1956
( Manfredi 1956 ;
Akkari et al. 2010
).
